alert.note: Alert for Alcona; Alpena; Crawford; Iosco; Missaukee; Montmorency; Ogemaw; Oscoda; Presque Isle; Roscommon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 11 at 3:58PM EDT until April 12 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...Fire Weather Watch Wednesday Afternoon and Evening... .DISCUSSION...Temperatures warming through the 70s and into the lower 80s...combined with critical relative humidity values and west to southwest winds gusting to 30 mph will result in dangerous fire weather conditions Wednesday afternoon and evening across areas along and east of the I-75 corridor in northern Lower Michigan. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Gaylord has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * TIMING...Starting approximately midday Wednesday and continuing through approximately 9pm Wednesday evening. * WINDS...West to southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 to 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...76 to 83 degrees. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
